TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit MediaExtractor extends Java.Lang.Object

Docs.summary: MediaExtractor facilitates extraction of demuxed, typically encoded, media data from a data source.

remarks.para: MediaExtractor facilitates extraction of demuxed, typically encoded, media data from a data source.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed
.method public hidebysig instance bool Advance() cil managed

Docs.summary: Advance to the next sample.

remarks.para: Advance to the next sample. Returns false if no more sample data is available (end of stream).

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class System.Threading.Tasks.Task`1<bool> AdvanceAsync() cil managed

Docs.summary: To be added.
Returns an estimate of how much data is presently cached in memory expressed in microseconds.

remarks.para: Returns an estimate of how much data is presently cached in memory expressed in microseconds. Returns -1 if that information is unavailable or not applicable (no cache).

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance bool GetSampleCryptoInfo(class Android.Media.MediaCodec/CryptoInfo info) cil managed

Docs.param: The android.media.MediaCodec.CryptoInfo structure to be filled in.
Docs.summary: If the sample flags indicate that the current sample is at least partially encrypted, this call returns relevant information about the structure of the sample data required for decryption.

remarks.para: If the sample flags indicate that the current sample is at least partially encrypted, this call returns relevant information about the structure of the sample data required for decryption.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class Android.Media.MediaFormat GetTrackFormat(int32 index) cil managed

Docs.summary: Get the track format at the specified index.

remarks.para: Get the track format at the specified index. More detail on the representation can be found at

Docs.summary: Returns true iff we are caching data and the cache has reached the end of the data stream (for now, a future seek may of course restart the fetching of data).

remarks.para: Returns true iff we are caching data and the cache has reached the end of the data stream (for now, a future seek may of course restart the fetching of data). This API only returns a meaningful result if indicates the presence of a cache, i.e. does NOT return -1.

MemberSignature.Value: .property instance class System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary`2<class Java.Util.UUID, unsigned int8[]> PsshInfo

Docs.summary: Get the PSSH info if present.

remarks.para: Get the PSSH info if present.

MemberSignature.Value: public int ReadSampleData (Java.Nio.ByteBuffer byteBuf, int offset);
.method public hidebysig instance int32 ReadSampleData(class Java.Nio.ByteBuffer byteBuf, int32 offset) cil managed

Docs.summary: Retrieve the current encoded sample and store it in the byte buffer starting at the given offset.

remarks.para: Retrieve the current encoded sample and store it in the byte buffer starting at the given offset.
Note: As of API 21, on success the position and limit of byteBuf is updated to point to the data just read.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void SelectTrack(int32 index) cil managed

Docs.summary: Subsequent calls to , and only retrieve information for the subset of tracks selected.

remarks.para: Subsequent calls to , and only retrieve information for the subset of tracks selected. Selecting the same track multiple times has no effect, the track is only selected once.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void SetDataSource(class Java.IO.FileDescriptor fd) cil managed

Docs.param: the FileDescriptor for the file you want to extract from.
Docs.summary: Sets the data source (FileDescriptor) to use.

remarks.para: Sets the data source (FileDescriptor) to use. It is the caller's responsibility to close the file descriptor. It is safe to do so as soon as this call returns.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void SetDataSource(string path) cil managed

Docs.param:
the path of the file, or the http URL of the stream
When path refers to a local file, the file may actually be opened by a process other than the calling application. This implies that the pathname should be an absolute path (as any other process runs with unspecified current working directory), and that the pathname should reference a world-readable file. As an alternative, the application could first open the file for reading, and then use the file descriptor form .
Docs.summary: Sets the data source (file-path or http URL) to use.

remarks.para: Sets the data source (file-path or http URL) to use.

MemberSignature.Value: public void SetDataSource (Java.IO.FileDescriptor fd, long offset, long length);
.method public hidebysig instance void SetDataSource(class Java.IO.FileDescriptor fd, int64 offset, int64 length) cil managed

Docs.param: the FileDescriptor for the file you want to extract from.
the offset into the file where the data to be extracted starts, in bytes
the length in bytes of the data to be extracted
Docs.summary: Sets the data source (FileDescriptor) to use.

remarks.para: Sets the data source (FileDescriptor) to use. The FileDescriptor must be seekable (N.B. a LocalSocket is not seekable). It is the caller's responsibility to close the file descriptor. It is safe to do so as soon as this call returns.

This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which contains the java.lang.Class JNI value corresponding to this type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control which jclass is provided to methods like .

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which provides the declaring type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control virtual vs. non virtual method dispatch against the underlying JNI object. When this property is equal to the declaring type, then virtual method invocation against the JNI object is performed; otherwise, we assume that the method was overridden by a derived type, and perform non-virtual methdo invocation.
